definition: nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]
meals (abbr. for 伙食[huo3 shi2])/variant of 夥|伙[huo3]
companion/partner/group/classifier for groups of people/to combine/together

sentences.english: If you want to avoid herpes, have only one sex partner.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想避免得疱疹，就专注于你现在的性伙伴吧。

sentences.english: Humans and chimps, it turns out, value age in sexual partners very differently.
sentences.chinese: 原来，人类和黑猩猩对性伙伴年龄的选择极其不同。

sentences.english: There are a variety ways to please your partner sexually.
sentences.chinese: 有各种各样的方法可以愉悦你的性伙伴。

sentences.english: Regular partners should still have chlamydia and blood tests.
sentences.chinese: 对经常的性伙伴还需要进行衣原体和血液检测。

sentences.english: They also broke down the data of the number of sexual partners by age.
sentences.chinese: 他们还根据年龄绘制了性伙伴数量的图表。

sentences.english: “It is not important for us whether your partner is a man or a woman, ” she said.
sentences.chinese: “对我们来说，你的性伙伴是男是女不重要，”她说。

sentences.english: I can't be the best shag he's ever had.
sentences.chinese: 我不可能是他有过的最佳性伙伴。

definition: to fall into bad company/to make acquaintances indiscriminately
